title: CURATOR-127 Fix trivial warnings
body:
Remove wildcard imports. Add generic types to Class.
Add serialVersionUID to Serializable.

title: Curator 123
body: ConnectedReadOnly should be considered a "negative" state and not cause the CONNECTED state to get posted.

title: CURATOR-124 - PathChildrenCache StartMode documentation improvement
body:
Updated `PathChildrenCache.StartMode.NORMAL` JavaDoc to accurately depict the cache startup behavior.

Added test `testChildrenInitializedNormal` to assert the startup behavior indicated in the JavaDoc.

My IDE is also configured to remove trailing white space by default. If this is a problem I can remove those changes and resubmit.

title: CURATOR-121 - Modified exception handling on the operation queue
body: Modified exception handling on the operation queue to ignore InterruptedException during shutdown. Added additional unit test for this case.

title: CURATOR-120 NodeCache and PathChildrenCache should not write
CURATOR-119 Match LICENSE file to ASF 'Gold Copy'
CURATOR-118 Add config to release plugin
body:
Auto-version submodules because they should all be the same version.
Add tag template to match the existing precedent.
Don't push tag until it's been voted on.
Use local checkout to save on bandwidth.

title: CURATOR-116 - Modified sorting of children to be deterministic.
body: Modified sorting of children to be deterministic.

title: CURATOR-93 - Added compress() option for transactions.
CURATOR-114 - Modified the TestingServer to expose the restart() method
body: Modified the TestingServer to expose the restart() method on the underlying TestingZooKeeperServer. Modified all unit tests that were previously using the stop() and then recreate using existing temporary directory and port approach for restarting the server, so that they now just call the restart() method.

title: initial BasicAuthExhibitorRestClient
body:
that can also skip ssl cert validation if required

Also might be nice to provide a convenience method in ExhibitorEnsembleProvider, something like

``` java
pubic static ExhibitorEnsembleProvider fromURL(URL vip, boolean validateSsl)
```

which would create the `Exhibitors` from the hostname, extract the userInfo, port and path from the url

title: Fix of DistributedAtomicValue#compareAndSet to work with empty node
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-108

Fix of DistributedAtomicValue#compareAndSet to work with value from node with no data (byte[0]{}). Such value is not equal to correct zero representation of integer (byte[4]{0,0,0,0}) and long (byte[8]{0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0}) in terms of Arrays.equals.

title: Curator locks leaving dangling watches
body:
As per https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-107 . I've seen this in our services too. 

The issue is because the code is using exists() call rather than getData() for creating a watch for lock. exists() creates a watch regardless of whether the node exists or not, getData() will only create the watch if node exists

title: CURATOR-90
body: Making Connection erros less verbose. Only first error is logged with error level; subsequent errors are logged as debug

title: make ChildData constructor public for access from unit tests and such
body: When unit testing an application making use of PathChildrenCache, I wanted to make some PathChildrenCacheEvents to pass to my PathChildrenCacheListener-implementing class. However I found that PathChildrenCacheEvent contains ChildData, which has only a no-modifier constructor, meaning my unit test would have to be in the org.apache.curator.framework.recipies.cache package in order to perform these tests.

title: Avoid erroneous 'Could not cancel' warning produced by cache tasks
body:
When closing providers, we regularly see an erroneous warning related to a failure to cancel cache tasks.

This change applies some more defensive checks before attempting to cancel tasks, ensuring that the cancel operation is only attempted if the future has not completed.

title: Curator 94
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CURATOR-94

Added some docs (based on my understanding) for ServiceType

Updated ServiceDiscoveryImpl.registerService so that PERMANENT registrations are not stored within the service.

This is to prevent two side effects:

When the ServiceDiscoveryImpl class is closed all PERMANENT registrations are deleted.
This is not desireable since callers who create PERMANENT registations should expect them to survive until explicitly deleted.

PERMANENT registrations should be stateless with respect to a particular service discovery client (assume a cluster of rest services).
It should be possible to use any of them to register/unregister.
It is not desirable to keep re-registering them whenever the client losses/reconnects to Zookeeper.

title: Added CloseMode support to LeaderLatch
body:
Added CloseMode support to LeaderLatch in order to be able to trigger the notLeader() callback when a Latch is manually closed.

The patch allows the close mode to be set either:
- During the creation of the latch so that the behavior is applied during a Closeable.close() call.
- Or on the close call to allow more specific control of notification behavior.

JIRA Issue to be added shortly.
